intro: Saldanhaea weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's saldania, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
